alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 12:51PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hunterdon, southwestern Warren and southeastern Northampton Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alpha, or near Easton, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Easton, Forks, Wilson, Harmony, Alpha, West Easton, Tatamy, Bloomsbury, Riegelsville, Glendon, Phillipsburg and Stockertown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 75 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
